meanings.definition: Showing or requiring great attention to detail
meanings.sent1: She is very finnicky about her artwork, making sure every brushstroke is perfect.
meanings.sent2: The finnicky architect spent hours adjusting the angles of the model building.
meanings.sent3: The finnicky cat insisted on rearranging its toys in a specific order.
meanings.sent4: Her finnicky nature when it comes to organizing her closet is like a puzzle master at work.
meanings.sent5: The finnicky chef could taste the slightest difference in seasoning.

meanings.sent1: The finnicky eater refused to try any new foods at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: He is so finnicky that finding a movie both of them enjoy is a challenge.
meanings.sent3: The finnicky customer returned the shirt three times before finding one to their liking.
meanings.sent4: Her taste buds were as finnicky as a picky toddler at mealtime.
meanings.sent5: Trying to please the finnicky boss was like walking on eggshells.

meanings.sent1: The finnicky toddler would only wear socks with cartoon characters on them.
meanings.sent2: She was so finnicky about the font size that she spent hours adjusting it.
meanings.sent3: The finnicky computer user rearranged the icons on the desktop multiple times.
meanings.sent4: His finnicky behavior towards cleanliness was like a neat freak on overdrive.
meanings.sent5: The finnicky customer demanded to speak to the manager for the smallest issue.
